original: Jonsson, Axel, direktör, generalkonsul, Särö, f. 16/5/88 i Gbg av dir. Axel J. o. Ragnhild Lundgren. G. 1. 14 m. Sigyn Janson, d. 34; 2. 41 m. Maud Sundström. Barn: Ingela f. 16, Ragnhild 17, Ake 19, Maud 26. — Stud. v. handisk. i Dresden 04, Lübeck 05, Antwerpen 06 o. London 07-09. Res. t. Tyskl, Engl., Frankr., ItaL, Ungern, Belg., Holl., Medelh iländ., Egypten, Främre Indien, m. fl. Grund, firma Jonsson & Krafft 10, verkst. dir. i Angfart. A-B Göta Kanal 19-28, verkst. dir. i A-B Sv. Amerika Linien sed. 29. Ital. gen:konsul i Gbg sed. 33. Led. av styr. f. Sv. Amerika Linien, Ängfart. A-B Tirfing, Sv. Lloyd, Rederi A-B Hallandsbol., Rederi A-B Gbg-Fredrikshavn-Linjen, A-B Göta Kanal, Svies redarefören., Sv:es Angfart. Assur ifören., A-B Götaverken, Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B o. För-säkr. A-B Atlantica, v. ordf. i Sv:es a’llm. sjöfartsfören., led. av styr. f. Sv. turisttrafikförb., A-B Nord. Resebyrå o. Sv.-Amer. Nyh :byrån, v. ordf. i Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti, led. av styr. f. Sv:e-Amerika stift., ordf. i Sv. sällsk. f. räddn. av skeppsbrutna, led. av styr. f. Nora Bergslags Järnv. A-B, Broströms Linjeagentur, SILA, Gbgs konstfören., Röhsska mus. vänner, Gbgs mus. o. Gbgs turisttrafik-fören. KV02kl, RNO, StOffTunNI, KDD02gr, KltKrO, KLitVytO, KNS:tOO, KFinlVRO, NyaSvM 38, Dansk FrM.
translated:
Jonsson, Axel, director, consul general, Särö, b. May 16, 1888 in Gothenburg to director Axel J. and Ragnhild Lundgren. Married 1. in 1914 to Sigyn Janson, who died in 1934; 2. in 1941 to Maud Sundström. Children: Ingela b. 1916, Ragnhild b. 1917, Åke b. 1919, Maud b. 1926. Studied at commercial schools in Dresden in 1904, Lübeck in 1905, Antwerp in 1906 and London from 1907-1909. Traveled to Germany, England, France, Italy, Hungary, Belgium, the Mediterranean, Egypt, and the Far East, among others. Founded the firm Jonsson & Krafft in 1910, was director at Angfart A-B from 1919-1928 and was a director at A-B Swedish America Line from 1929. Became an Italian consul general in Gothenburg in 1933. Member of the board for Swedish America Line, Ängfart A-B, Tirfing A-B, Swedish Lloyd, Rederi A-B Hallandsbol., Rederi A-B Gothenburg-Fredrikshavn Line, A-B Göta Kanal, Swedish Shipowners' Association, Swedish East India Assurance, A-B Götaverken, Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B and Insurance A-B Atlantica. Vice chairman of the Swedish General Maritime Association, a member of the board of directors for the Swedish Tourist Traffic Association, A-B Nordiska Resebyrå and Swed-Amer News Agency, chairman of the National Association for Swedes Residing Abroad, a member of the board of the Swed-America Foundation, chairman of the Swedish Society for the Rescue of the Shipwrecked, a member of the board for Nora Bergslags Järnväg A-B, Broström's Linjeagentur, SILA, Gothenburg's Art Association, Röhsska Museum Friends, Gothenburg's Museum and Gothenburg's Tourist Traffic Association. Awards: Knight of the Order of the Seraphim in 1902, Commander of the Royal Norwegian Order in 1932, Commander 2nd Class of the Order of Dannebrog, Commander of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Knight of the North Star Order, Knight of the Finlands Vita Ros' orden, and New Swedish Medal in 1938.

Note: '\d\d m. partners name' means that the person married in the year 19xx.
